channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: National Center for Atmospheric Research to Be Dismantled, Trump Administration Says
item.description: Russell Vought, the White House budget director, called the laboratory a source of “climate alarmism.”

item.title: Italy makes a surprising discovery ahead of the Winter Olympics: dinosaur tracks
item.description: A nature photographer stumbled upon thousands of 210-million-year-old dinosaur tracks in Italy's central Alps, near where some Olympic skiing and snow...

item.title: A Chinese man who filmed secret footage in Xinjiang risks deportation from the U.S.
item.description: Guan Heng sailed to the U.S. by boat from the Bahamas after publishing footage he filmed of purported detention camps in China. He has been held in im...

item.title: Trump to address the nation as his popularity dips in the face of economic concerns
item.description: The year-end speech will address his accomplishments so far and look ahead to next year

item.title: The New Flu Variant Could Spread Widely This Year. Here’s What to Know.
item.description: Scientists have expressed alarm about the dominant version of the virus that’s circulating now.

item.title: Stabbing Near Chabad Headquarters Investigated as a Possible Hate Crime
item.description: A dispute on a Brooklyn street appeared to explode after the perpetrator made antisemitic statements, the police said.

item.title: Federal court says troops can stay in D.C., and hints at prolonged deployment
item.description: A federal appeals court in Washington, D.C. has ruled that National Guard troops can remain in the city for now. That decision comes after a different...

item.title: Jack Smith defends his prosecutions of Trump in closed-door session in Congress
item.description: The former Justice Department special counsel told the House Judiciary Committee that his team developed "proof beyond a reasonable doubt" that Trump ...

item.title: Oscars Reach Deal With YouTube
item.description: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences said it had reached a deal with YouTube for exclusive rights to the show starting in 2029.

item.title: Video Footage Shows Nick Reiner Enter Store an Hour Before His Arrest
item.description: Mr. Reiner was filmed entering a gas station’s store in South Los Angeles to buy a sports drink roughly an hour before he was arrested by the police a...

item.title: Trump Orders Blockade of Some Oil Tankers to and From Venezuela
item.description: The move is an escalation of military operations and a pressure campaign against Nicolás Maduro, Venezuela’s leader. But its scope and economic impact...

item.title: A Militant’s Transformation
item.description: Ahmed Al-Sharaa, a former Al Qaeda ally, is now president of Syria. We look at his transformation, and whether he can transform his country, too.

item.title: Finland Apologizes to China, Japan and South Korea for Racist Gesture
item.description: A Finnish beauty queen was stripped of her crown for a gesture mocking Asians. After Finnish lawmakers have copied her, Finland’s prime minister is tr...

item.title: More Than 2,000 Dinosaur Footprints Are Found in the Italian Alps
item.description: Two hundred million years ago, prosauropods walked the earth. They left something behind.

item.title: UK Rejoins EU’s Erasmus Student Exchange Program That It Left After Brexit
item.description: The government said it would pay about $760 million to allow young Britons to take part in 2027.
